adopted only to extent necessary to allow for full adoption in superseding version of data series ie minimal needed adoption

standard: `source data` and `work files` must be licensed
preprint must *appropriately* cite `source data` and `v 1.5` and `work files`
elucidation: citation must inc persistent identifier eg doi and must be listed in reference section

standard: `v 1.5` must be deposited in trusted digital repository
elucidation: `v 1.5` must be clearly and precisely documented, and must be maximally available, and must inc all vars and records described in preprint

standard: `work files` must be deposited in trusted digital repository
elucidation: `work files` must be clearly and precisely documented, and must be maximally available, and must inc full acct of `pre work` and of `work` st `work files` are sufficient to precisely reproduce `v 1.5` independently

standard: `source data` must be deposited in trusted digital repository
elucidation: `source data` must be clearly and precisely documented, and must be maximally available

standard: preprint must inc design and log details of `pre work` and `work`
elucidation: details must meet a relevant EQUATOR std = https://www.equator-network.org/reporting-guidelines/prisma *or* some other relevant std in https://www.equator-network.org; preprint must confirm whether std were reviewed, relevant, and followed
notes: col 'varid' val given 'lvl iii' in source file but corrected on review; lvl iii not relevant here

standard: preprint must state whether `pre work` and `work` were preregistered in independent institutional registry
elucidation: statement must be in acknowledgements section or in first footnote
notes: not possible to preregister source data; lvls ii-iii not relevant here; col 'adoption' val given 'no' ie 'none' in source file but corrected on review

standard: as no=16 adding '* and must state whether prereg inc analysis plan'
elucidation: for analysis plan specifying sequence of analyses or statistical model used
notes: lvls i-iii not relevant here; col 'adoption' val given 'yes' ie 'full' *or* 'part' in source file but corrected on review

standard: article journal encourage submission of replication studies
`v 1.5` must distinguish raw from processed or generated data values
